name: citizenM Amsterdam City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: European hotel prices are on the high side if you are coming form the U.S.
reviews.title: Small but wonderfully efficient and affordable

reviews.text: This little gem of a hotel keeps the pricing down and is a smart choice for the budget conscious traveler. Location is very good, not to far from the center of town and tram stop is right outside of hotel. In case you are traveling through Europe, the train station is alos just a 3 minute walk.
reviews.title: Practical & comfortable with everything at your fingertips!! Unbiased Review

reviews.text: The rooms are EFFICIENT. Meaning small, but very modern. if you are newly dating your partner..this room might nt give the privacy you're used too, as the bathroom is practically on top of your bed.
reviews.title: Love it! LOVE IT!!!

reviews.text: Overall very very good value for the price paid. Really like the "vibe" of this "concept hotel. would for sure returm.
reviews.title: perfect for business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel 21st - 24 August 2011, we had two rooms and 4 guests.
reviews.title: simple but perfect hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is everything the website promises. Simple, stylish, clean, comfortable and great value for money. The bed is enormous and very comfortable.The drench shower is a dream.The mood pad to operate the lighting, heating, blinds and tv worked great. The check in was quick and easy and the staff were friendly, helpful and informative.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar/breakfast area is good and has a wide selection of drinks and meals.
reviews.title: Great Concept, Great Value, Great Location...

reviews.text: The hotel is easy to find. From the airport take the train for 1 stop to Zuid station. Exit the station and walk across the square between the two WTC buildings.Walk through the underpass beneath the highway and then turn right when you pass the office/apartment block ( you will see the sign)
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

reviews.text: There is ample space in the room for 2 people. The only downside was a lack of space for hanging clothes and no coffee making facilities ( essential 1st thing in the morning)
reviews.title: So Trendy... Maybe at the expense of comfort?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tram stop (no 5) is 5 mins from the front door( turn left and left again) and takes about 20 mins to the central station.
reviews.title: Modern, quirky and unique!

reviews.text: Having read a lot about Citizen M, I was looking forward to the experience - and it did not disappoint. Great design, cool concept, quirky ideas, friendly service, efficiency are all here. Check in is self service - which is perfect (why pay for a large Reception Team, for something you are quite capable of doing yourself - there is someone on hand to help if necessary). The rooms are modular and very well designed. A massive bed and two pods containing the shower and toilet. Everything is controlled by a remote - TV, blinds, lighting (which you can choose a mood), alarm etc... Downstairs there is a great self service cafe (24 hours), with friendly bar staff for drinks. There is a large selection of sandwiches and some hot meals. Breakfast is simple and very nice (great coffee). There is also a living area, with relaxing and working zones (plus free, easy to connect wi-fi throughout). The brand marketing is funky and has interesting twists. There are also great innovations, such as your room key is also a payment card. If you love travel and to experience something new - you must experience Citizen M. I love it!
reviews.title: The future - why cant all hotels be like this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have spent three nights on this hotel and we are very pleased. Good value for money, very functional, no waste of space, perfect for technology lovers, very comfy and big bed and the staff is very helpful. I personally liked the power-rain shower and the lightning of the room. Also the movies on demand and free WiFi is always a plus.
reviews.title: Very comfy and functional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are a hotel traditional sort of people and not open to new experiences please stay away of this hotel. For those who love new experiences and ways to do tourism this is your place.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel!!

reviews.text: Although there are some downfalls i.e. the canteen was too expensive vs. what is offering. The temperature of the room couldn't be warmer than 23ºc meaning that if it is cold for you there is no other option, not even been able to switch it off! There a light streaming of air coming from the window which is quite unpleasant.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel, would definitely go back!

reviews.text: But overall I have to say this is a great hotel, modern, cool, functional and comfortable.
reviews.title: Very innovative concept - very, very innovative

reviews.text: Fast check in, small room, very nice lobby area! Friendly staff, great coffe, need improvements on food. A cool hotel!
reviews.title: stylish, modern, hip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The nice hotel is situated in a god position (near Tram 5 Stop and Amsterdam Zuid Station) but the rooms are really very small. Dispate the overall positive feedback i suggest to choice a different hotel to visit the city. For 10€ you can have a fast breakfast, there is not a restaurant in the building but in the neighborhood area you can find some good restaurants such as Wagamama or Japanis.
reviews.title: Hotel Nice but rooms too small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel, first impressions were excellent. The lobby was ultra modern with decor that exudes style and exuberance. Hotel staff were also incredibly friendly. The room itself is puny though, there's hardly space to stow the luggages and walk around without hitting something. The concept is great, but there has to be a balance between space and style.
reviews.title: Fantastic decor with tiny rooms

reviews.text: The mood pad didn't always work the way it should. Window blinds did not fold or move in the right direction, room lights sometimes take at least five presses on the remote control to turn off, TV controls are unresponsive, and the list goes on. I'm not sure if it boils down to bad luck, but I did change the room once due to faulty air conditioning, and the problems persisted.
reviews.title: Loved every minute of it!

reviews.text: Travellers staying in this hotel should take note of these niggling problems just in case they happen to you. But otherwise, stay in this hotel and enjoy what it has to offer.
reviews.title: Neat (in all senses) place to stay

reviews.text: I really liked this hotel. Not just it's room, the large bed and all the things that you can easily see at first sight. It' s also all the little small details that you will surprisingly find just about everywhere. From the lift, to the bathroom bottles.
reviews.title: It 's not just a hotel, it's a way to live.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's very cool, I would dare to say it's a piece of art.
reviews.title: would not recommend

reviews.text: I will not come in to any detail, because that would be similar to spoilers for a movie. It's amazing to let your self discover the mobile citizen you hide inside you!
reviews.title: Unique Stay in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hope to see more citizen ms around the world.
reviews.title: The place is good for a short stay for 1-2 days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for 4 days in June 2011. We where told on the phone before we arrived that we could park our car outside the hotel. That was true, but they didnt tell us that it would cost us 3 Euros per hour. We where however able to park in a different location, so where given a map of how to get there. That would then cost us 6 Euros a day. The only problem was that we then had to get there using the map, which was very confusing, and quite far away. When we did find it, it turned out that it was not 6 Euros a day, but 8 Euros. At that time we where very tired, as we had driven all the way from Denmark. The last thing we wanted to do was walking around Amsterdam using a map getting back to the hotel. The hotel room was clean and bright, but that where it stops. No space anywhere to hang your clothes, a tiny shelf for toilettries, the smallest bin ive ever seen, and the bed was very hard and uncomfortable. And to get into bed, one person had to climb over the other( not easy at night if you had a drink) Ive been with my husband for a long time, but we both still prefer to go to the toilet in privat, and thats not possible in the room.
reviews.title: Wow, loved it. Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose that hotel following the reviews on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed at all. On the contrary. On top of that, the staff was really friendly. The room was very well isolated.
reviews.title: surprising hotel, comfortable especially the bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The connection to the Central Train station is very convenient.
reviews.title: Another vote for CitizenM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a lot of positive reviews for this hotel, and those reviews are well deserved. Like the MotelOne chain in Germany, CitizenM does the basics well - huge comfortable bed, good location, internet - but with a twist - love the moodpad! I wouldn't necessarily pay extra for the trendy stuff, but at this price, it's a bit of fun to tell your friends about when you get home!
reviews.title: It didn't fulfill my expectations...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amsterdam is a compact, walkable city. We bought a 10 ride ticket from the central station on arrival, and then used the tram outside the front door to get into the city centre. I recommend a leisurely stroll through the Jordaan district - this is a picturesque residential neighbourhood with a great atmosphere, and less touristy than the centre of town.
reviews.title: Best stop in Amsterdam

reviews.text: PS - when we stayed in October 2010, in front of the lifts on the ground floor, there was a very, ahem, interesting photomontage showing the side view of a series of hotel rooms - check it out (not for the faint hearted, lol!) Love this city!
reviews.title: Excellent lounge and bartenders

reviews.text: Okay, it's my fault I got chocolate on the bed sheets. It is Amsterdam, home of milk chocolate, after all. But you'd think the cleaning staff might have changed the sheets. I spent my last of three nights at the hotel sleeping on my shame. That detail aside, Citizen M represents good value for Amsterdam. Central Station is about 20 minutes away on the tram. Use of space in the room is really commendable and the beds are quite comfortable. I didn't pre-pay the breakfast -- which I understand is about 9 Euros for all you can out. I chose a la carte and my choices amounted to about 7 Euros a day, which seemed reasonable to me. Free WiFi, nice common spaces and free movies are a nice touch.
reviews.title: Good value b

reviews.text: This hotel has a great location and convenient to access the main attractions in the centre and it has a very cosmopolitan style to it! Everything is minimalistic, there are no doors to the bathroom or shower so you can literally see when someone is in there, so be careful who you share with! after a day, you just laugh at it but at first it is very awacquard. If you are looking for a cosy, romantic soace, then this is not the place. I went there with my husband and three friends and we didnt mind it as we were there for three nights during new years. The hotel's breakfast is not hot, only cold croissants, pastries, etc so we never had breakfast there. Staff are helpful during check in as you check in yourself in their hotel screens and you need the staff to guide you through the process. the tram is outside the hotel but in the local area there is nothing much apart from a couple of bars / caffes.
reviews.title: CitiZenM - be careful who you share with!

reviews.text: I reccomend this hotel for a trip with friends or if you going on business! the room is very small and if you planning to stay too long in the room, it is not advisable! you ll be bumping into each other.
reviews.title: Good.... But I understand why it's so cheap!

reviews.text: The hotel is very conveniently located if you are coming from the airport. It's very close and easy to get to with the interlink train. Once at the station take your left and walk straight across the square, wtc building is on the right and side.
reviews.title: Real Low-Cost Luxury

reviews.text: As soon as I got there, one of the stewards welcomes me and helped with the checkin. Within seconds, I was asked to insert my card and pay the full amount. It is an additional €19.95 for early check in which I did as I got there early morning and check in is not until 2pm. There is also an additional cost id paying by card that is not maestro.
reviews.title: Has Potential.

reviews.text: Ok where do I start, Myself,My partner & another couple stayed at the Citizen M Amsterdam, From the moment we walked in we where like 'WOW', Such a trendy/Cool hotel, On arrival you check yourself in on there little high tech computers, there is a staff member there to help you if you get stuck. Once we got checked in we went to room 330 which was a garden view :) the rooms our cool & funky, the shower is great & you can set the mood off the room with the funky colour lighting :) Hotel staff where lovely if you need extra towel etc they where with you stright away :)
reviews.title: Absolutly Loved every minute of it :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only downfall I didnt like was when the housekeepers needed into the room & you had on DO NOT DISTRUB sign on the door (because someone kept taking ours off the door) the housekeepers would off tried entering with there little cards the lights in the room would come on :( Which was a pain when you are in a nice sleep!! Also the Breakfast bag which was 9.95 is not worth it as you only get a yoghurt,Coisant,tea,orange juice & an apple, We were told we could get a hot breakfast at any time & when I went to get a hot breakfast I was told it was unavailable so I had to then get a breakfast bag which was a total rip off!!!
reviews.title: What an experience!

reviews.text: Other than that I would defo recommend this hotel & I will be back next year only for longer :D Hotel is in a great location also :)
reviews.title: Great if you are travelling light and looking for a cheap option

reviews.text: Thank you Citizen M for such a plesant stay :D
reviews.title: Felt a bit like a space ship....but loved it!
Good Stay
reviews.text: This is a hotel for tech freaks like me. Everything is trendy, cool, interactive and fast. This is no place for old people who likes afternoon tea with biscuits as the most excitment that they get in a day... this is for people who lives fast! Great place, great people and great overall experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed in CitizenM this summer for 3 nights. The hotel is located very close to tram station where you can reach the city center in nearly 15 minutes. When you walk into the building, you can recognize that this is not a routine hotel. The rooms are mid size with very modern design. You can use a remote control for controlling the curtain, room temperature TV and even color of the lighting.
reviews.title: Good & clean hotel, not an ordinary hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Rooms are very clean and staff is very kind. The bed is very large and nearly 1/3 size of the room.
reviews.title: Excellent , very quirky!!

reviews.text: Pros: There are no place to put the luggage, and other stuff. And also there may be a refrigrator in the room.
reviews.title: great hotel, great people, fantastic time

reviews.text: Me & my girlfriend stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago.
reviews.title: Still pretty good - prefer it in non tourist season though :)

reviews.text: Its a little out the way but a simple tram ride will take you there. The hotel is very clean & smart. very modern with lots of apple macs & tv's.
reviews.title: Always citizenM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast should be more friendly. From our vacation we have the experience from four other hotels.So, for 10 euros we had full table in Poland, Germany, Italy and Swiss. The room is clean and bed is very good. Cool idea with all from features of SmartHouse!
reviews.title: We loved it and may be we'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: By no means your average place to stay. Service, cleanlines and cost are exceptional in this wonderfully modern hotel (great electronic controls for lights, TV and shades to create just the right ambiance in your room, ultra modern lobby) 24 hour food and beverage availability and convenient access to the train station and Schipol airport. For a first or last nite in Amsterdam, this is the place to stay. We arrived late and the restaurant staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. We hope to try other citizenM hotels around the world.
reviews.title: George Jetson would be jealous

reviews.text: me and my friends came for a long weekend, absolutely loved it. near enough to the leidespie; only a few stops on the tram and taxis were only 11 euros back at night. hotel was amazing, so comfortable, bright and clean. service was amazing, clean sheets and towels every day, unlimited movies and all staff were friendly and helpful. price was extremely reasonable but the bar prices were slightly expensive.
reviews.title: we'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOVED IT!
reviews.title: Overrated, Overpriced and seemed like a hostel. Ideal for 1 night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent a long weekend here with my girlfriend and my experience here was ok but I wouldn't return. The location from the airport is good. A quick train ride from Schnipol to Zuid station is cheap and takes a few minutes but the city it too far away.
reviews.title: Small and overrated!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent most of my time in Amsterdam with a cold and arrived late one evening ready for a hot tea and my bed. The staff members were friendly and greeted me with enthusiasm - and were very helpful when helping me to use the self check-in terminals. You can choose from a room with a city-view, or a garden-view - unless you're on one of the higher floors (I was on the first floor), it doesn't really matter.
reviews.title: Modern design, friendly staff but just a little too out of centre for short breaks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is stylish and it's been designed to feel like you're sat in your fashionable friend's lounge. Books concerning art and design adorn the shelves and the TVs show various European channels. There's a real hostel feel to it and nearly all of the employees are in their twenties - yet there are many older guests staying too.
reviews.title: Would Stay Here Again

reviews.text: The rooms are designed either for singles or couples. They're small and compact, but the space is used brilliantly - two cylinders form the toilet and shower - the toilet is covered in matte glass, but the shower is transparent (it's not really the place I'd choose if holidaying with friends), but it was a fun touch.
reviews.title: very exciting, hip place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entire room's functions are controlled with a remote control - you can turn off or dim the lights with it, change channel on the TV, change the temperature etc. And the bed was wonderful - it's a huge king-sized, very comfy bed. And everything is very clean!
reviews.title: Minimalistic, futuristic, great service, rooms a bit small

reviews.text: The hotel is in the heart of the business quarter - it's around 20 minutes by tram (tram number 5, which leaves from outside the hotel) to the centre, but the tram was packed every time I rode it (I was being grumpy with my cold, but I'd have appreciated a seat). Alternatively you can take the metro to the central station - the metro is around a 5 minute walk from the hotel next to the World Trade Center. I was only in Amsterdam for a few days, so the 20-30 minute journeys weren't ideal and being in the heart of the city would have been easier - but it was a minor issue.
reviews.title: Very good price - quality ratio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked citizenM after reading reviews on tripadvisor. We weren't disappointed. From the minute we arrived and someone was immediately on hand to take our bags to the safe left luggage area it was fantastic. The rooms are not as poky as they look in photos - the huge windows mean they feel very airy. The MASSIVE bed is also great for chilling out on as well as sleeping.
reviews.title: Different and fantastic!

reviews.text: Little touches, like the coloured mood pad, being able to pick our room on check in (floor/view depending on availability), two shower gels (one "day" one "night", and also how quiet it was but still on a tram route to town just made it a really enjoyable stay. Definitely reccommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Great and fun place, very convenient

reviews.text: Food was a bit expensive, but we found it expensive everywhere in Amsterdam to be honest.
reviews.title: Loved the concept, execution needs work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel, the location is convenient as very easy to go to the center of Amsterdam by tram. The rooms are fitted for short stays, with a wonderful big bed and very easy to use amenities. Internet everywhere and free of charge, free movies and a nice cantine where you can have all kind of snacks and drinks all around the clock. Friendly staff and fun athmosphere top it all!
reviews.title: Please open similar places all over Europe!!

reviews.text: Great concept for any kind of frequent traveller!
reviews.title: choice for business in AMS

description: Located in Central Amsterdam on Beethovenstraat this hip Netherlands hotel offers affordable luxury for budget travelers, lodging near museums, free Wi-Fi, movies on demand, and 24/7 on-site dining.
